info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 25 at 7:22AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...AREAS OF FREEZING FOG CONTINUE TO IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL NEW MEXICO... Areas of freezing fog will continue to linger over east central New Mexico, including the Clovis and Portales areas through mid morning. Freezing fog will create low visibity with some localized areas reducing to near one half mile at times. In addition, the freezing fog will deposit a thin glaze of ice on some road surfaces, especially over bridges and overpasses where slick travel conditions can be expected. Motorists and travelers are urged to slow down, allow extra time to reach their destination, and use low beam headlights. The fog is expected to lift and dissipate through the morning between about 8am and 10 am MST.
